text: Raül Agné Montull (born 24 May 1970) is a Spanish retired footballer who played as a central defender, and a manager. ==Playing career== Born in Mequinenza, Zaragoza, Aragon, Agné never competed in higher than Segunda División B during his 14-year senior career. He represented Real Zaragoza B, Girona FC (two stints), UE Figueres, CD Binéfar, Palamós CF, retiring in 2004 at the age of 34. Whilst with Binéfar, Agné shared teams with his twin brother Vidal, and also acted as manager to the youth sides. ==Coaching career== Agné began his coaching career at CF Peralada one year after retiring, missing out on promotion from Tercera División in his first season. In 2006, he was appointed at former club Palamós, leaving the following year.Raúl Agné no sigue (Raúl Agné does not continue); Mundo Deportivo, 1 June 2007 In June 2007, Agné signed with Girona.Girona presentará el lunes a Agné (Girona will present Agné on monday); Mundo Deportivo, 28 June 2007 After leading the team to Segunda División promotion in the play-offs, he was sacked on 18 May 2009 after a bad run of results.Raúl Agné, destituido tras mala racha de resultados en la segunda vuelta (Raúl Agné, sacked after a bad run of results in the second turn); Diario AS, 18 May 2009 Agné moved to Recreativo de Huelva on 1 December 2009,Raúl Agné, nuevo técnico del Recre (Raúl Agné, new manager of Recre); Marca, 1 December 2009 resigning on 14 June of the following year due to "personal reasons".Raúl Agné no continuará en el banquillo del Recre "por motivos personales" (Raúl Agné leaves Recre's bench "due to personal reasons"); Diario AS, 14 June 2010 He returned to Girona the following summer,Raúl Agné vuelve como entrenador al Girona (Raúl Agné returns as Girona manager); Marca, 21 July 2010 taking them to a comfortable mid-table finish in the second level in his debut campaign and subsequently renewing for two years;Raúl Agné renueva con el Girona por dos temporadas (Raúl Agné renews with Girona for two seasons); Sport, 28 June 2011 he was relieved of his duties, however, on 15 January 2012.El Girona destituye a Raul Agné y apuesta por Josu Uribe (Girona sack Raul Agné and bet on Josu Uribe); La Vanguardia, 15 January 2012 On 10 December 2012, Agné joined Cádiz CFEl Cádiz anuncia la contratación del técnico Raúl Agné (Cádiz announce signing of manager Raúl Agné); Marca, 10 December 2012 as the club neared the relegation zone in the third level. He was sacked on 18 March 2014, with the side still in that tier.Agné, destituido como entrenador del Cádiz (Agné, sacked as manager of Cádiz); Diario de Cádiz, 18 March 2014 Agné was named CD Tenerife manager on 3 February 2015, taking over from Álvaro Cervera at the second division team.Raúl Agné, nuevo técnico del CD Tenerife (Raúl Agné, new manager of CD Tenerife); CD Tenerife, 3 February 2015 On 3 November, after 31 competitive games – one in the Copa del Rey – he was dismissed.Raúl Agné, destituido como técnico del CD Tenerife (Raúl Agné, dismissed as CD Tenerife manager); CD Tenerife, 3 November 2015 After nearly one year without a club, Agné replaced sacked Luis Milla at the helm of Real Zaragoza.Acuerdo para la contratación de Raúl Agné como nuevo técnico del Real Zaragoza (Agreement for the signing of Raúl Agné as the new manager of Real Zaragoza); Real Zaragoza, 25 October 2016 On 19 March 2017, he was sacked.César Láinez sustituye a Raúl Agné como entrenador del Real Zaragoza (César Láinez replaces Raúl Agné as manager of Real Zaragoza); Real Zaragoza, 19 March 2017 Agné moved abroad for the first time in December 2017, when he took the job at Nei Mongol Zhongyou F.C. of China League One. He and compatriot assistant Arnau Sala left the following August, with the team second from bottom. In October 2019, Agné came back to Spain's third division, replacing Enrique Martín at the helm of Córdoba CF for the rest of the season with the option of a second. He lasted only until 10 March, when he himself was replaced by Juan Sabas. ==Personal life== Whilst at the service of Girona, Agné walked out of a press conference in February 2011 following an away game against SD Huesca after not being allowed to express himself in Catalan.Raül Agné marxa de la roda de premsa perquè no el deixen parlar en català (Raül Agné leaves press conference because he is not allowed to speak in Catalan); Avui, 13 February 2011 This sparked a wave of solidarity on the internet,Raül Agné fa furor a la xarxa després de plantar els periodistes per no poder parlar en català (Raül Agné becomes a net sensation after walking out on journalists for not being allowed to speak in Catalan); TV3, 18 February 2011 and Catalan essayist Quim Monzó wrote an opinion piece on the subject for La Vanguardia under the title "! تحيا كاتالونيا حرة" (Arabic translation of the independentist slogan Visca Catalunya Lliure! – Long Live Free Catalonia!).! ¿¿¿¿ ¿¿¿¿¿¿¿¿¿ ¿¿¿; La Vanguardia, 15 February 2011 ==Managerial statistics== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |+ Managerial record by team and tenure |- !rowspan="2"|Team !rowspan="2"|Nat !rowspan="2"|From !rowspan="2"|To !colspan="8"|Record !rowspan=2| |- ! title: Raül Agné
